pages.name: Wolfhook route
pages.desc:
**Wolfhooks ${Wolfhook}** can be found in the wilderness around Wolvendom and are being sold by [**Chloris**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Chloris_fb0f2e00.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A berry with thorns that often gets attached to a wolf's pelt. When you look at it, you can almost hear the echoing cries of the wolves in the woods.

pages.name: Valberry route
pages.desc:
**Valberries ${Valberry}** can be found in the wilderness of Stormbearer Mountains and are being sold by [**Chloris**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Chloris_66f0dbee.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A plump and translucent berry that has a fragrant smell and a sweet, refreshing taste. In the past, the storm watchers' only solace was the sweetness of this fruit and hope for the city's peace.

pages.name: Cecilia route
pages.desc:
**Cecilias ${Cecilia}** can be found in the wilderness of Starsnatch Cliff and are being sold by [**Flora**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Flora_e27a3f13.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A beautiful flower with a name that suits its appearance. It only grows where harsh winds blow, and is just as intangible as the true heart of an unbound soul.

pages.name: Windwheel Aster route
pages.desc:
**Windwheel Asters ${Windwheel Aster}** can be found in the wilderness of Mondstadt and are being sold by [**Flora**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Flora_8c7f0a59.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A plant that adores the wind. To the proud children of the wind, or the citizens of Mondstadt, the Windwheel Asters are "the visible winds."

pages.name: Philanemo Mushroom route
pages.desc:
**Philanemo Mushrooms ${Philanemo Mushroom}** can be found in under the eaves of houses in Mondstadt and are being sold by [**Chloris**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Chloris_d44fc52a.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A fungus that grows in the warm caress of the wind. It is as everlasting as the wind, nourishing life.

pages.name: Small Lamp Grass route
pages.desc:
**Small Lamp Grass ${Small Lamp Grass}** can be found all over Mondstadt and glows at night. It is also being sold by [**Flora**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Flora_f509195a.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A wild grass that emits light at night. Used in cooking to enhance other flavors.

pages.name: Calla Lily route
pages.desc:
**Calla Lilies ${Calla Lily}** can be found near lakes in Mondstadt and are being sold by [**Flora**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Flora_57aeaaad.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A flower that grows near water sources. When cooked, the petals have a chunky texture, yet are sweet and a little bitter.

pages.name: Dandelion Seed route
pages.desc:
**Dandelion Seeds ${Dandelion Seed}** can be found in the wilderness of Mondstadt and at Mondstadt gates. They are also being sold by **Karpillia** for way too much mora (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A tiny seed that rides on the wind. Even without its feathered wings, it still holds the hope from afar within.

pages.name: Cor Lapis route
pages.desc:
**Cor Lapis ${Cor Lapis}** can be found in the wilderness of Liyue and are being sold by [**Changshun**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Changshun_1eb0adc1.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A precious crystal of condensed pure Geo element that usually grows along with other minerals. It's also commonly called "Cor Petrae."

pages.name: Jueyun Chili route
pages.desc:
**Jueyun Chilis ${Jueyun Chili}** can be found in the wilderness of Liyue and are being sold by [**Chef Mao**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Chef_Mao_7f1dfb18.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A spicy plant native to Liyue. Merely smelling it makes one hot and thirsty.

pages.name: Noctilucous Jade route
pages.desc:
**Noctilucous Jades ${Noctilucous Jade}** can be found in caves in Liyue. They are being sold by [**Shitou**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Shitou_3d0ef1a8.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A rare mineral that glimmers in the dark. It's said to be a mutated gemstone condensed from the flourishing elements of the world.

pages.name: Silk Flower route
pages.desc:
**Silk Flowers ${Silk Flower}** can be found in the near Yujing Terrace and Wangshu Inn. They are being sold by [**Ms. Bai**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Ms._Bai_f531c867.png) and [**Verr Goldet**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Verr_Goldet_27aaca4a.png) (up to 5 each per 3 days).

> A crimson flower that blooms like the rainbow clouds in Liyue. It can be made into silky-smooth fabric.

pages.name: Glaze Lily route
pages.desc:
**Glaze Lilies ${Glaze Lily}** can be found in the wilderness of Liyue and are being sold by [**Ms. Bai**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Ms._Bai_517cdf0d.png) (up to 3 per week).

> An extremely ancient flower that was said to be commonly seen in Liyue. It transforms the memories of the land into its fragrance during florescence.

pages.name: Qingxin route: Main Liyue
pages.desc:
**Qingxins ${Qingxin}** can be found in the heights of stone forests in Liyue and are being sold by [**Herbalist Gui**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Herbalist_Gui_cb4dfa44.png) (up to 10 per 3 days).

> A translucent white flower that only grows on the highest stone peaks. It eschews the warmth and moisture of the plains to gaze out afar from the solitary mountaintops.

pages.name: Qingxin route: The Chasm
pages.desc:
**Qingxins ${Qingxin}** can be found in the heights of stone forests in Liyue and are being sold by [**Herbalist Gui**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Herbalist_Gui_cb4dfa44.png) (up to 10 per 3 days).

> A translucent white flower that only grows on the highest stone peaks. It eschews the warmth and moisture of the plains to gaze out afar from the solitary mountaintops.

pages.name: Starconch route
pages.desc:
**Starconches ${Starconch}** can be found on the beaches of Liyue and are being sold by [**Bolai**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Bolai_41308ed9.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> Empty seashells brought ashore by the tides. Hold it close to your ear, and hear the longing calls of the sea.

pages.name: Clearwater Jade route
pages.desc:
**Clearwater Jades ${Clearwater Jade}** can be found in Chenyu Vale, Liyue and are being sold by **Fengtai** (up to 5 per 3 days).

> Jade from Chenyu Vale. Named for its cool, refreshing touch, that is much like clear water.

pages.name: Onikabuto route
pages.desc:
**Onikabuto ${Onikabuto}** can be found in the wilderness of Inazuma.

> A strange beetle that inhabits areas rich with Electro energy. Its docile and sedentary temperament could not be more different from the fierce, demonic visage displayed on its armored shell.

pages.name: Sakura Bloom route
pages.desc:
**Sakura Blooms ${Sakura Bloom}** can be found in the wilderness of Inazuma.

> Blossoms from the Sacred Sakura at the Grand Narukami Shrine, filled with a fondness for Inazuma.

pages.name: Crystal Marrow route
pages.desc:
**Crystal Marrow ${Crystal Marrow}** can be found in the wilderness of Inazuma.

> A crystal that contains a sliver of Tatarigami power. Adding this material during smelting will greatly increase the strength and toughness of metals.

pages.name: Dendrobium route
pages.desc:
**Dendrobiums ${Dendrobium}** can be found in the wilderness of Inazuma.

> A vibrant plant that has also been named the "lycoris" by the poets. It was once thought extinct in the Inazuman archipelago, only to re-emerge now upon the battlefields. It is said that it blooms most enchantingly where much blood was spilled.

pages.name: Naku Weed route
pages.desc:
**Naku Weeds ${Naku Weed}** can be found in the wilderness of Inazuma and are being sold by [**Aoi**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Aoi_a6aead3f.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The part of it that resembles petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.

pages.name: Sea Ganoderma route
pages.desc:
**Sea Ganoderma ${Sea Ganoderma}** can be found in Inazuman seawater and are being sold by [**Obata**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Obata_ba6bc721.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A plant species that only grows in certain regions and islands of the ocean. Though it looks like a fungus of some sort, it actually comes from a substance secreted by certain soft-bodied organisms.

pages.name: Sango Pearl route
pages.desc:
**Sango Pearls ${Sango Pearl}** can be found in the wilderness of Watatsumi Island and are being sold by [**Yamashiro Kenta**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Yamashiro_Kenta_071cf2e8.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> A precious pearl that grows in the coral of Watatsumi. Gives off a cool sheen like that of a moonlight.

pages.name: Amakumo Fruit route
pages.desc:
**Amakumo Fruits ${Amakumo Fruit}** can be found in the wilderness of Seirai Island.

> The fruit of the Amakumo Grass, which grows on Seirai Island. You can hear it crackling with a tiny current if you hold it up to your ear.

pages.name: Fluorescent Fungus route
pages.desc:
**Fluorescent Fungi ${Fluorescent Fungus}** can be found in the wilderness of Tsurumi Island.

> A mushroom that glows like a night-light. Some curious power lies hidden within it.

pages.name: Rukkhashava Mushrooms route
pages.desc:
**Rukkhashava Mushrooms ${Rukkhashava Mushrooms}** can found in the wilderness of Sumeru, near Ashavan Realm and Lokapala Jungle and are being sold by [**Aramani**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Aramani_13df9c31.png) and [**Ashpazi**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Ashpazi_82f8a0b8.png) (up to 5 each per 3 days).

> A fungus that grows in layers upon layers, like a sea of clouds, and which mostly grows on trees deep in the rainforest. Therefore, they are considered by the people of Sumeru to be the holy crystallization of Rukkhadevata’s legacy.

pages.name: Padisarah route
pages.desc:
**Padisarah ${Padisarah}** can found near Sumeru City and are being sold by [**Jut**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Jut_1c2963bd.png) (up to 5 times per 3 days).

> A holy and noble plant. The conditions for growth in its environment are very demanding. The flower buds can be processed to make valuable spices.

pages.name: Nilotpala Lotus route
pages.desc:
**Nilotpala Lotus ${Nilotpala Lotus}** can found near lakes and river banks in Sumeru.

> Growing in the forest wetlands, these plays only bloom at night with flowers as bright as the moon.

pages.name: Kalpalata Lotus route
pages.desc:
**Kalpalata Lotus ${Kalpalata Lotus}** can found in the mountains of Sumeru and are being sold by [**Aramani**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Aramani_13df9c31.png) (up to 5 per 3 days).

> Flowers from vines that grow on cliff sides. It is called a lotus only because it has a similar appearance to one. Aside from that, it bears no other similar properties to the lotus.

pages.name: Redcrest route
pages.desc:
**Redcrest ${Redcrest}** can found in the Great Red Sand of Sumeru.

> A fruit that grows even in the most hostile of desert environments. It's vibrant crimson fruits are made even more lovely against a backdrop of yellow sand.

pages.name: Sand Grease Pupa route
pages.desc:
**Sand Grease Pupa ${Sand Grease Pupa}** can found in the Desert of Hadramaveth.

> You can only find such husks deep in the desert where the Quicksand Eels breed. The hardened shell is meant to protect the Quicksand Eels' larval bodies until they finally acclimate to the conditions of the dry desert.

pages.name: Mourning Flower route
pages.desc:
**Mourning Flower ${Mourning Flower}** can found in Girdle of the Sands.

> Crimson flowers that bloom on ancient battlefields. They can even flourish in the depths of the desert. Their drooping flowers seem to be in mourning for heroes long past.

pages.name: Trishiraite route
pages.desc:
**Trishiraite ${Trishiraite}** can found in Girdle of the Sands.

> A splendorous stone that can be found in the depths of desolate mountains, seemingly formed from congealed elemental energy.

pages.name: Scarab route
pages.desc:
**Scarab ${Scarab}** can found in the Great Red Sand of Sumeru.

> A tenacious beetle that finds repose within the vast ocean of desert sand. The golden pattern on such beetles' shells hints at some deep relationship between them and the ancient ruins that dot the desert.

pages.name: Beryl Conch route
pages.desc:
**Beryl Conches ${Beryl Conch}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine, near Salacia Plain and are being sold by **Hinterman** (up to 5 each per 3 days).

> A conch-like structure that gives off a faint glow. Despite the name, it is not a shell but something condensed from pure elemental energy.

pages.name: Romartime Flower route
pages.desc:
**Romartime Flowers ${Romartime Flower}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine, near Salacia Plain and are being sold by **Hinterman** (up to 5 each per 3 days).

> An ethereal and elegant blue flower. Its tender petals are elastic and water-absorbent, making it the ideal raw material for various daily necessities.

pages.name: Lumidouce Bell route
pages.desc:
**Lumidouce Bells ${Lumidouce Bell}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine, north of the Court of Fontaine.

> A serene and tranquil violet flower. It has a light, soft, and lasting scent and is often used for making luxurious perfumes.

pages.name: Rainbow Rose route
pages.desc:
**Rainbow Roses ${Rainbow Rose}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine, near Beryl Region.

> A delicate and tender pink flower. Despite their name, Rainbow Roses are essentially more akin to Lilies.

pages.name: Lumitoile route
pages.desc:
**Lumitoiles ${Lumitoile}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine, near Liffey Region.

> A soft-bodied animal that emits a gentle light. Often found climbing the walls of buildings near the water or underwater.

pages.name: Subdetection Unit route
pages.desc:
**Subdetection Units ${Subdetection Unit}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine, near Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering Region.

> Detection units produced by Fontaine Research Institute using new models of artificed components. Its original purpose was monitoring all kinds of environmental data.

pages.name: Lakelight Lily route
pages.desc:
**Lakelight Lilies ${Lakelight Lily}** can be found in the wilderness of Fontaine near Erinnyes Forest.

> A clear and clean azure flower, it is born where Water Veins come together. It has a simple, cool, and elegant fragrance, pungent and refreshing yet gentle.

pages.name: Frog route
pages.desc:
**Frogs** can be found in the wilderness near bodies of fresh water. They are used in crafting.

> Common frog found in moist environments. Full of energy, they secrete a substance that will keep you full of vitality.

pages.name: Crystalflies (Crystal Core) route
pages.desc:
**Crystal Cores** can be obtained by catching Crystalflies in the wilderness.

> The core of a crystal butterfly. It absorbs elemental energy that had escaped into the atmosphere.

pages.name: Loach Pearl route
pages.desc:
**Loach Pearls** can be found in the wilderness near bodies of water.

> A shiny pearl spat out by a loach that has mystical medicinal properties. Minerals and elemental particles ingested by the loach condense into these mildly magical beads. When threatened, the loach spits them out to confuse predators and escape with its life.

pages.name: Unagi Meat route
pages.desc:
**Unagi** can be found on Watatsumi Island.

> The fresh meat of an Unagi. If handled properly, it can be used to make fresh, lovely food.

pages.name: Viparyas route
pages.desc:
**Viparyas** can be found in Sumeru.

> A flower without seeds. Once the earth remembers, the Viparyas will bloom.

pages.name: Ajilenakh Nut route
pages.desc:
**Ajilenakh Nuts** can be found in Sumeru and are being sold by Azalai (up to 10 per day).

> A fruit that grows on evergreen trees within desert oases. The flesh under the tough skin is thick, sweet, and delicious, making it an important food source amongst the desert peoples.

pages.name: Condessence Crystals route
pages.desc:
**Condessence Crystals ${Condessence Crystal}** can found in the wilderness of Fontaine.

> A bright and clear crystal with a core that is both tough and malleable.

pages.name: Pluie Lotus route
pages.desc:
**Pluie Loti ${Pluie Lotus}** can found near lakes and river banks.

> A plant that grows in environments rich with Hydro. This plant can be found everywhere in Fontaine after its long rainy seasons. The plant is named "Pluie" - which means "rain" in the local tongue - for that reason.

pages.name: Tidalga route
pages.desc:
**Tidalgas ${Tidalga}** can found while diving.

> An algae floating with the tides that sustains itself by feeding on substances produced by other plants. Though often mistaken for zooplankton, based on its nature, Tidalga is actually a type of phytoplankton.

pages.name: Spring of the First Dewdrop route
pages.desc:
**Spring of the First Dewdrops ${Spring of the First Dewdrop}** can be found underwater in Morte Region.

> A limpid drop of dew floating amidst the waters of Morte Region. It is different from other pure water bodies, as though it is a conglomeration of even more pure and primordial Elemental Energy.

pages.name: Maple Wood route
pages.desc:
**Maple Wood** can be obtained from the Amur Maple and can be used to create furnishings.

> Excellent quality wood with a fine color and texture.

pages.name: Aralia Wood route
pages.desc:
**Aralia Wood** can be obtained from the Inazuman Cedar and can be used to create furnishings.

> It is soft, has straight veins, and gives off a light fragrance.

pages.name: Otogi Wood route
pages.desc:
**Otogi Wood** can be obtained from the Otogi Tree and can be used to create furnishings.

> It has just the right amount of moisture and oil, and as such has a great many uses.

pages.name: Yumemiru Wood route
pages.desc:
**Yumemiru Wood** can be obtained from Sakura Trees and can be used to create furnishings.

> Exquisite in quality and full of moisture, people say that it can lull people into dreams as sweet as the warm spring.

pages.name: Sandbearer Wood route
pages.desc:
**Sandbearer Wood** can be obtained from Sandbearer Trees and can be used to create furnishings.

> Said to be an exceptionally hardy plant resistant to wind and rain with a long lifespan.

pages.name: Whopperflower route (Whopperflower, Shimmering and Energy Nectar): Inazuma
pages.desc:
**Whopperflowers ${Pyro Whopperflower}${Electro Whopperflower}${Cryo Whopperflower}** are Common Enemies found wandering in the wild or disguised as plants such as Mints and Sweet Flowers. They are Mystical Beasts and drop **Whopperflower Nectar ${Whopperflower Nectar}**, **Shimmering Nectar ${Shimmering Nectar}** and **Energy Nectar ${Energy Nectar}**.

This route only contains Whopperflowers in **Inazuma**.

pages.name: Fatui Skirmisher route (Recruit's Insignia, Sergeant's Insignia and Lieutenant's Insignia)
pages.desc: **Fatui Skirmishers ${Geochanter Bracers}${Pyroslinger Bracers}${Cryogunner Legionnaires}${Hydrogunner Legionnaires}${Anemoboxer Vanguards}${Electrohammer Vanguards}** are Common Enemies found across Teyvat. They are members of the Fatui and drop **Recruit's Insignia ${Recruit's Insignia}**, **Sergeant's Insignia ${Sergeant's Insignia}** and **Lieutenant's Insignia ${Lieutenant's Insignia}**.

pages.name: Nobushi route (Old, Kageuchi and Famed Handguard)
pages.desc: **Nobushi ${Nobushi: Jintouban}${Nobushi: Hitsukeban}${Nobushi: Kikouban}** are Common Enemies found in Inazuma. They drop **Old Handguard ${Old Handguard}**, **Kageuchi Handguard ${Kageuchi Handguard}** and **Famed Handguard ${Famed Handguard}**.

pages.name: Specter route (Spectral Husk, Heart and Nucleus): Inazuma
pages.desc: **Specters ${Hydro Specter}${Anemo Specter}${Geo Specter}${Electro Specter}${Cryo Specter}** are Common Enemies found in Inazuma. They are Elemental Lifeforms and drop **Spectral Husk ${Spectral Husk}**, **Spectral Heart ${Spectral Heart}** and **Spectral Nucleus ${Spectral Nucleus}**.

pages.name: Specter route (Spectral Husk, Heart and Nucleus): Enkanomiya
pages.desc: **Specters ${Hydro Specter}${Anemo Specter}${Geo Specter}${Electro Specter}${Cryo Specter}** are Common Enemies found in Inazuma. They are Elemental Lifeforms and drop **Spectral Husk ${Spectral Husk}**, **Spectral Heart ${Spectral Heart}** and **Spectral Nucleus ${Spectral Nucleus}**.

pages.name: Fungus route (Fungal Spores, Luminescent Pollen and Crystalline Cyst Dust): Sumeru
pages.desc: **Fungi ${Floating Dendro Fungus}${Floating Hydro Fungus}${Grounded Hydroshroom}${Stretchy Anemo Fungus}${Stretchy Geo Fungus}${Stretchy Pyro Fungus}${Whirling Cryo Fungus}${Whirling Electro Fungus}${Winged Cryoshroom}${Winged Dendroshroom}** are Common Enemies found in The Chasm. They are Mystical Beasts and drop **Fungal Spores ${Fungal Spores}**, **Luminescent Pollen ${Luminescent Pollen}** and **Crystalline Cyst Dust ${Crystalline Cyst Dust}**.

pages.name: Fungus route (Fungal Spores, Luminescent Pollen and Crystalline Cyst Dust): Enkanomiya
pages.desc: **Fungi ${Floating Hydro Fungus}** are Common Enemies found in The Chasm. They are Mystical Beasts and drop **Fungal Spores ${Fungal Spores}**, **Luminescent Pollen ${Luminescent Pollen}** and **Crystalline Cyst Dust ${Crystalline Cyst Dust}**.

pages.name: Eremites route (Faded Red Satin, Trimmed Red Silk and Rich Red Brocade)
pages.desc: **Eremites ${Eremite Axe Vanguard}, ${Eremite Crossbow}, ${Eremite Ravenbeak Halberdier}, ${Eremite Linebreaker}, ${Eremite Sword-Dancer}, ${Eremite Desert Clearwater}, ${Eremite Sunfrost}, ${Eremite Daythunder}** are Common Enemies found in Sumeru. They drop **Faded Red Satin ${Faded Red Satin}**, **Trimmed Red Silk ${Trimmed Red Silk}** and **Rich Red Brocade ${Rich Red Brocade}**.

pages.name: Fontemer Aberrant route (Transoceanic Pearl, Transoceanic Chunk and Xenochromatic Crystal)
pages.desc: **Fontemer Aberrants ${Angelic Sea Hare}, ${Armored Crab}, ${Ball Octopus}, ${Blubberbeast}, ${Bubbly Seahorse}, ${Hat Jellyfish}, ${Hunter's Ray}, ${Bubbler Seahorse}, ${Cherubic Sea Hare}, ${Sternshield Crab}** are Common Enemies found in Fontaine. They drop **Transoceanic Pearl ${Transoceanic Pearl}**, **Transoceanic Chunk ${Transoceanic Chunk}** and **Xenochromatic Crystal ${Xenochromatic Crystal}**.

pages.name: Fontemer Aberrant route (Transoceanic Pearl, Transoceanic Chunk and Xenochromatic Crystal) - 4.1 region
pages.desc: **Fontemer Aberrants ${Angelic Sea Hare}, ${Armored Crab}, ${Ball Octopus}, ${Blubberbeast}, ${Bubbly Seahorse}, ${Hat Jellyfish}, ${Hunter's Ray}, ${Bubbler Seahorse}, ${Cherubic Sea Hare}, ${Sternshield Crab}** are Common Enemies found in Fontaine. They drop **Transoceanic Pearl ${Transoceanic Pearl}**, **Transoceanic Chunk ${Transoceanic Chunk}** and **Xenochromatic Crystal ${Xenochromatic Crystal}**.

pages.name: Clockwork Meka route (Meshing Gear, Mechanical Spur Gear and Artificed Dynamic Gear) - 4.1 region
pages.desc: **Clockwork Mekas ${Area Alert Mek}, ${Arithmetic Enhancer Mek}, ${Geological Survey Mek}, ${Nimble Harvester Mek}, ${Recon Log Mek}, ${Underwater Patrol Mek}, ${Underwater Survey Mek}, ${Annihilation Specialist Mek}, ${Assault Specialist Mek}, ${Deepwater Assault Mek}, ${Construction Specialist Mek}, ${Suppression Specialist Mek}** are Common Enemies found in Fontaine. They drop **Meshing Gear ${Meshing Gear}**, **Mechanical Spur Gear ${Mechanical Spur Gear}** and **Artificed Dynamic Gear ${Artificed Dynamic Gear}**.

pages.name: Ruin Guard route (Chaos Device, Circuit and Core)
pages.desc: **Ruin Guards ${Ruin Guard}** are Elite Enemies found across Teyvat. They are Automatons and drop **Chaos Device ${Chaos Device}**, **Chaos Circuit ${Chaos Circuit}** and **Chaos Core ${Chaos Core}**.

pages.name: Ruin Sentinel route (Chaos Gear, Axis and Oculus): Inazuma
pages.desc: **Ruin Sentinels ${Ruin Cruiser}${Ruin Destroyer}${Ruin Defender}${Ruin Scout}** are Elite Enemies found in Inazuma. They are Automatons and drop **Chaos Gear ${Chaos Gear}**, **Chaos Axis ${Chaos Axis}** and **Chaos Oculus ${Chaos Oculus}**.

pages.name: Ruin Sentinel route (Chaos Gear, Axis and Oculus): Enkanomiya
pages.desc: **Ruin Sentinels ${Ruin Cruiser}${Ruin Destroyer}${Ruin Defender}${Ruin Scout}** are Elite Enemies found in Inazuma. They are Automatons and drop **Chaos Gear ${Chaos Gear}**, **Chaos Axis ${Chaos Axis}** and **Chaos Oculus ${Chaos Oculus}**.

pages.name: Ruin Drake route (Chaos Storage, Module and Bolt)
pages.desc: **Ruin Drakes ${Ruin Drake: Earthguard}${Ruin Drake: Skywatch}** are Elite Enemies found in Sumeru. They are Automatons and drop **Chaos Storage ${Chaos Storage}**, **Chaos Module ${Chaos Module}** and **Chaos Bolt ${Chaos Bolt}**.

pages.name: Primal Construct route (Damaged, Turbid and Radiant Prism)
pages.desc: **Primal Constructs ${Primal Construct: Prospector}${Primal Construct: Repulsor}${Primal Construct: Reshaper}** are Elite Enemies found in Sumeru. They are Automatons and drop **Damaged Prism ${Damaged Prism}**, **Turbid Prism ${Turbid Prism}** and **Radiant Prism ${Radiant Prism}**.

pages.name: Fatui Pyro Agent route (Knives and Insignia)
pages.desc: **Fatui Pyro Agents ${Fatui Pyro Agent}** are Elite Enemies found in Liyue and Inazuma. They are members of the Fatui and drop **Hunter's Sacrificial Knife ${Hunter's Sacrificial Knife}**, **Agent's Sacrificial Knife ${Agent's Sacrificial Knife}**, **Inspector's Sacrificial Knife ${Inspector's Sacrificial Knife}**, **Recruit's Insignia ${Recruit's Insignia}**, **Sergeant's Insignia ${Sergeant's Insignia}** and **Lieutenant's Insignia ${Lieutenant's Insignia}**.

pages.name: Fatui Cicin Mages route (Mist Grass and Insignia)
pages.desc: **Fatui Cicin Mages ${Fatui Electro Cicin Mage}${Fatui Cryo Cicin Mage}** are Elite Enemies found wandering by themselves. They are members of the Fatui and drop **Mist Grass Pollen ${Mist Grass Pollen}**, **Mist Grass ${Mist Grass}**, **Mist Grass Wick ${Mist Grass Wick}**, **Recruit's Insignia ${Recruit's Insignia}**, **Sergeant's Insignia ${Sergeant's Insignia}** and **Lieutenant's Insignia ${Lieutenant's Insignia}**.

pages.name: Fatui Mirror Maiden route (Dismal, Crystal and Polarizing Prism)
pages.desc: **Fatui Mirror Maidens ${Mirror Maiden}** are Elite Enemies found in Inazuma. They are members of the Fatui and drop **Dismal Prism ${Dismal Prism}**, **Crystal Prism ${Crystal Prism}** and **Polarizing Prism ${Polarizing Prism}**.

pages.name: Geovishap route (Fragile, Sturdy and Fossilized Bone Shard)
pages.desc: **Geovishaps ${Geovishap}** are Elite Enemies found in Liyue. They belong to the Vishaps and drop **Fragile Bone Shard ${Fragile Bone Shard}**, **Sturdy Bone Shard ${Sturdy Bone Shard}** and **Fossilized Bone Shard ${Fossilized Bone Shard}**.

pages.name: Abyss Mage route (Dead Ley Line Branch, Leaves and Sprout): Mondstadt and Liyue
pages.desc: **Abyss Mages ${Pyro Abyss Mage}${Hydro Abyss Mage}${Cryo Abyss Mage}** are Elite Enemies found around Teyvat. They belong to the Abyss and drop **Dead Ley Line Branch ${Dead Ley Line Branch}**, **Dead Ley Line Leaves ${Dead Ley Line Leaves}** and **Ley Line Sprout ${Ley Line Sprout}**.

pages.name: Abyss Mage route (Dead Ley Line Branch, Leaves and Sprout): Inazuma
pages.desc: **Abyss Mages ${Pyro Abyss Mage}${Hydro Abyss Mage}${Electro Abyss Mage}${Cryo Abyss Mage}** are Elite Enemies found around Teyvat. They belong to the Abyss and drop **Dead Ley Line Branch ${Dead Ley Line Branch}**, **Dead Ley Line Leaves ${Dead Ley Line Leaves}** and **Ley Line Sprout ${Ley Line Sprout}**.

pages.name: Abyss Mage, Herald and Lector route (Dead Ley Line Branch, Leaves and Sprout): Enkanomiya
pages.desc: **Abyss Mages ${Pyro Abyss Mage}${Hydro Abyss Mage}${Electro Abyss Mage}${Cryo Abyss Mage}**, **Abyss Herald ${Abyss Herald: Wicked Torrents}** and **Abyss Lector ${Abyss Lector: Violet Lightning}** are Elite Enemies found around Teyvat. They belong to the Abyss and drop **Dead Ley Line Branch ${Dead Ley Line Branch}**, **Dead Ley Line Leaves ${Dead Ley Line Leaves}** and **Ley Line Sprout ${Ley Line Sprout}**.

pages.name: Rifthound route (Concealed Claw, Unguis and Talon)
pages.desc: **Rifthounds ${Rockfond Rifthound Whelp}${Thundercraven Rifthound Whelp}${Rockfond Rifthound}${Thundercraven Rifthound}** are Elite Enemies found on Tsurumi Island. They belong to the Abyss and drop **Concealed Claw ${Concealed Claw}**, **Concealed Unguis ${Concealed Unguis}** and **Concealed Talon ${Concealed Talon}**.

pages.name: Black Serpent Knight route (Gloomy, Dark and Deathly Statuette)
pages.desc: **Black Serpent Knights ${Shadowy Husk: Standard Bearer}${Shadowy Husk: Line Breaker}${Shadowy Husk: Defender}${Black Serpent Knight: Windcutter}** are Elite Enemies found in The Chasm. They belong to the Abyss and drop **Gloomy Statuette ${Gloomy Statuette}**, **Dark Statuette ${Dark Statuette}** and **Deathly Statuette ${Deathly Statuette}**.

pages.name: Hilichurl Rogue route (A Flower Yet to Bloom, Treasured Flower and Wanderer's Blooming Flower)
pages.desc: **Hilichurl Rogues ${Anemo Hilichurl Rogue}${Hydro Hilichurl Rogue}** are Elite Enemies found in the Sumeru Desert. They belong to the Hilichurls family and drop **A Flower Yet to Bloom ${A Flower Yet to Bloom}**, **Treasured Flower ${Treasured Flower}** and **Wanderer's Blooming Flower ${Wanderer's Blooming Flower}**.

pages.name: Fatui Operative route (Old Operative's Pocket Watch, Operative's Standard Pocket Watch and Operative's Constancy)
pages.desc: **Fatui Operatives ${Frost Operative}${Wind Operative}** are Elite Enemies found in the Fontaine. They belong to the Fatui and drop **Old Operative's Pocket Watch ${Old Operative's Pocket Watch}**, **Operative's Standard Pocket Watch ${Operative's Standard Pocket Watch}** and **Operative's Constancy ${Operative's Constancy}**.

pages.name: Xuanwen Beast route (Feathery Fin, Lunar Fin and Chasmlight Fin)
pages.desc: **Xuanwen Beasts ${Xuanwen Beasts}** are Elite Enemies. They are Mystical Beasts and drop **Feathery Fin ${Feathery Fin}**, **Lunar Fin ${Lunar Fin}** and **Chasmlight Fin ${Chasmlight Fin}**.

pages.name: Praetorian Golem route (Ruined Hilt, Splintered Hilt and Still-Smoldering Hilt)
pages.desc: **Praetorian Golems ${Praetorian Golem}** are Elite Enemies. They are Mystical Beasts and drop **Ruined Hilt ${Ruined Hilt}**, **Splintered Hilt ${Splintered Hilt}** and **Still-Smoldering Hilt ${Still-Smoldering Hilt}**.

pages.name: Radiant Spincrystals
pages.desc: **Radiant Spincrystals** are used to unlock soundtracks in the Serenitea Pot. This guide includes the ones obtained from **Teyvat**, the other ones can be obtained from **Chubby**.

pages.name: Locked Gate with Lumenspar in Underground Mines
pages.desc: Lumenspar behind a locked gate that requires the use of map fragments.

pages.name: Locked Gate near Tiangong Gorge
pages.desc: Unlocked from the bottom of the underground north of the main mining area.

pages.name: "Paleontological Investigation" - Fossil Locations
pages.desc: Fossil locations for Khedive's "Paleontological Investigation" quest. Take pictures at the highlighted locations.

pages.name: "The Millenial Mountains" - Item Locations
pages.desc: Locations of the different items for the "The Millenial Mountains" quest.

pages.name: "The Nine-Word Rumor" - Text Locations
pages.desc: Locations of the secret messages for the "The Nine-Word Rumor" achievement. Unequip your Lumenstone so you can observere them.

pages.name: "If Not Us, Then Who?" - Fatui Action Log Locations
pages.desc: Fatui Action Log locations for the "If Not Us, Then Who?" achievement.

pages.name: "The Chasm Mining Records" - text fragment locations
pages.desc: Locations of the text fragments related to mining for the "The Chasm Mining Records" achievement.

pages.name: Damaged Stone Slate locations
pages.desc: Locations of the 7 Damaged Stone Slates that you need to find. Needed for The Bunkoku Enigma event quest. Solution for the tile puzzle is also available (see next page).

pages.name: The Bunkoku Enigma Tile Puzzle solution
pages.desc: Solution for tile puzzle that is needed for The Bunkoku Enigma event quest. Locations of the 7 Stone Slates that are needed are also available (see previous page).

pages.name: Evernight Temple Electro Monument puzzle
pages.desc: Unlocking the Evernight Temple during the event requires the activation of 4 Electro monuments.

pages.name: South-west Island 3 Seelie locations
pages.desc: Locations of the 3 Seelies needed for a trial during the event.

pages.name: Stellar Reunion has gotten a new look!
pages.desc:
You can now earn rewards by completing new sets of missions including; **Reunion Locales** where you explore the new regions and clearing 3 given Archon quests for the **Homeward Path**!

**Passage of Time** daily login rewards increased to 500 Primogems, 5 Fragile Resin and 1 Northlander Billet Trove total.
There is also the **Reunion Blessing** which provides 4 daily double rewards from Domains of Blessing, Forgery, Mastery or Ley Line Blossoms for 7 days, increased from 3 daily attempts.
Finally **Returning Companions** provides 3 Keys you can use to unlock Character Story Quests and Hangouts for free.
**Returning Gift Package** and **Homeward Path** daily quests have been removed, distributing their rewards among the other benefits.

In total you can now obtain 500 Primogems, 8 Fragile Resin, 54 Hero's Wits, 48 Mystic Enhancement Ore and 630000 Mora in addition to the double drops and **Returning Companions** Keys!

pages.name: How to get to Fontaine
pages.desc:
There is no need to manually go all the way to Fontaine!
There will be some waypoints automatically unlocked in/near Fontaine if you have completed "Prologue: Act III - Song of the Dragon and Freedom" Archon quest! (Mondstadt Archon quest)

If using the Waypoint in the Realm of Farakhert you can take a waverider to the Romaritime Harbor Statue of the 7 using the path as shown [here](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Path_f184cdc2.png).

pages.name: How do I gain exploration progress for Reunion Locales
pages.desc: There are a number of Major questlines that can be done to access locked areas, you can find their start locations [here](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Questlines_158be03b.png).

name: Unlocking The Chasm: Underground Mines in the Archon Quest: Requiem of the Echoing Depths

pages.name: Unlocking The Chasm: Underground Mines
pages.desc:
Originally, completing the world quest *"Surreptitious Seven-Star Seal Sundering"* as part of *"The Chasm Delvers"* series was necessary to gain access to The Chasm: Underground Mines. However, thanks to the optimization introduced in 4.3, navigating to the underground mines while completing the Archon Quests has become easier.
After completing the sub-quest *"Look for the miner who posted the commission at The Chasm"*, **a teleport waypoint in The Chasm: Underground Mines will unlock automatically**. This waypoint can then be used by opening the map and navigating to The Chasm: Underground Mines after opening the layered map by clicking the current region's name in the bottom right corner.

pages.name: Exploring in the Archon Quest
pages.desc:
While the (mini-)map might be covered in a black mist - this shouldn't pose an issue for progressing through the Archon Quest as the quest markers will still be visible and are within a short distance of eachother (shown below).

If the screen is too dark, you may increase the game's brightness by opening the Paimon Menu → Settings → Graphics → Brightness. The Lumenstone can also be used to lighten up the area around you and can be unlocked while completing the world quest *"The Chasm Delvers"*. While progressing through this world quest, more and more areas of the map will also become visible, removing the black mist.

pages.name: Fast Equip Artifacts
pages.desc:
The 4.4 update introduces two new methods to quickly equip Artifacts to your characters. You can either use the "Quick Loadout" or "Custom Loadout" feature after clicking the "Fast Equip" button on the character's Artifact screen.

The "Quick Loadout" feature will generate and equip a set (of currently unused) Artifacts based on recently active players. This can be useful to quickly equip a character without having to check how said character should be equipped. For more advanced users there's also a "Custom Loadout" feature which allows you to select the Artifact Main Affix, Set Type and prioritize certain Minor Affixes, as well as to use all Artifacts in your inventory (including those equipped on other characters).

pages.name: Other Optimizations
pages.desc:
The Serenitea Pot also has some optimizations. The Filter and Search functions have been improved and the Furnishings have been re-organized into different categories. The editing screen no longer resets the scroll position when switching Furnishing categories and the Companion list now shows the current Friendship Level of each Companion.

The Adventure's Handbook will now show a red prompt when the Daily Commission rewards haven't been claimed from Katheryne. Selecting "Claim Rewards" will guide you towards Katheryne.

A "Borderless Mode" has been added to the Graphics Settings. This will allow you to play the game in a borderless window, which can be useful to have other applications stacked on top of the game such as your browser with a guide or map.

pages.name: Qiaoying Village
pages.desc: Famous throughout Teyvat, in upper Chenyu Value you should visit Qiaoying Village as it prides itself in providing high quality tea and living a rich tradition of it. It is not all too surprising then that "Qiaoying" means "tea" in traditional chinese culture.

pages.name: Yilong Wharf
pages.desc: While Liyue Harbor proudly stands as Liyues biggest trade hub, far up north in the country Yilong Wharf guards the eastern port of Liyue, watching the straits to Fontaine.

pages.name: Mt. Xuanlian
pages.desc: Shaped by mountains, Chenyu Vale has many fascinating geological formations, such as the ethereal Mt. Xuanlian, easily recognizable by its peaks that seem to defy gravity. Sacred Springs can be found running from the sides of the mountains here, guided by Jade Hairpins.

pages.name: Tea with Friends
pages.desc: Famous for its Adeptea and possessing many beautiful landscapes, there's nothing better than relaxing alongside friends with a cup of this fragrant beverage under the shade of a tree.

pages.name: Jademouth
pages.desc: Shaped by history, a final adventure of friends, Jademouth and Mt. Lingmeng stand as monuments to the calamities of the past. Legends speak of a slab of Jade on a sacred mountain, which was thrown into the water. This is believed to be the origin of the name "Chenyu" meaning "Sunken Jade". Perhaps Jademouth may be able to help you on your journey to uncover these story to this legend.

pages.name: Guhua Clan
pages.desc: Proclaimed the stronghold of the Guhua Clan, what mysteries does this gate hide? Grand Master Guhua is told to have established 12 Secret Chambers within upon its creation, hiding long forgotten treasures inside, can such a story really be true?

pages.name: The Adepti
pages.desc: Like other regions of Liyue, various Adepti have been present during Chenyu Vales rich history. You may even stumble upon their tracks during your exploration.

pages.name: Herblord
pages.desc: One of the Adepti of Chenyu Vale, "Herblord" took on the shape of a white snake. This reminds you of Changsheng, Baizhus trusty companion. Maybe they are related?

pages.name: Simulacrums
pages.desc: Peculiar statues known as "Simulacrums" can be found around Chenyu Vale as well. Some even appear to be lost! Return them where they belong and they may reward you for your efforts.

pages.name: Ancient Ruins
pages.desc: Scattered around Chenyu Vale many Ancient Ruins can be found, resting in disrepair and weathered by time. Yet maybe an intrepid adventurer would be able to restore them to be as *Good as New*.

pages.name: Chiori Quick Overview
pages.desc:
Chiori, the Thundering Seamstress is a 5 star Geo Sword character from Inazuma, though in the present day you will find her running Chioriya Boutique in Fontaine, being the designer of the outfits of many known faces like Kirara and Navia!

Chiori is primarily an off-field damage dealer, doing significant damage through her summoned constructs, known as **Tamoto**. Her damage comes primarily from her Elemental Skill, which in addition to summoning "Tamoto" to the field, features a new Quick-Time Event which can trigger different effects based on input during it.

pages.name: Normal Attack Mechanics
pages.desc:
Chiori's Normal Attack talent is quite simple, performing up to 4 consecutive elegant strikes.

Her Charged Attack performs a quick double slash in front of her, and moves her slightly backwards, being one of the few Sword characters who step back instead of forwards.

Generally, her Normal Attacks are not too valuable to use before she has her 6th Constellation unlocked, but when she does, she becomes quite a potent on-field damage dealer as well.

As an additional flair, the flowers that appear after her 4th Normal Attack will match the color of any infusion currently active on her!

pages.name: Elemental Skill Mechanics
pages.desc:
As Chiori's kit primarily revolves around her Elemental Skill knowing how it works is crucial to use Chiori to her full potential!

When activating her Elemental Skill, Chiori will lunge forward and perform a slash dealing Geo DMG to all enemies hit, then summoning a **Tamoto** to the field
- After activating this skill, if her 1st Ascension Passive is unlocked, it will also trigger a Quick-Time Event, granting Chiori either **Tailoring** if a Normal Attack is performed during it or **Tapestry** if her Elemental Skill is pressed again.
- **Tailoring** grants Chiori a Geo infusion for 5 seconds, allowing her to perform an on-field role if desired, though without her final Constellation her Normal Attacks do not do significant damage.
- **Tapestry** immediately switches Chiori to the next character in your party, ignoring the character-switching cooldown, then allows **Tamoto** to perform coordinated attacks when your allied Normal/Charged or Plunging attacks hit the enemy up to two times.
- If no action is input **Tailoring** will trigger once the time event passes - Note that if you manually switch to a different character during this window, neither effect will be triggered.

You can also hold down her Elemental Skill to aim where she dashes - this can be used to launch her into the air to perform a plunging attack, and she can even swap to another character mid air!

pages.name: Tamoto and Kinu Mechanics
pages.desc:
While her Elemental Skill summons **1 Tamoto**, a second can be summoned if there is a Geo Construct near the first **Tamoto** doll when Chiori uses her skill, or if a construct is created nearby while it exists.
- Note that the distance from the construct to summon another is based on proximity to the existing **Tamoto** and not Chiori herself.
- The duration of each **Tamoto** is independent and only one each from her Elemental Skill and additional one from construct can exist at one time - Her C1 **Tamoto** shares a limit with the additionally summoned one.

**Tamoto** will do Geo DMG in a small AoE to a nearby enemy at regular intervals and can grant between 1-2 Geo particles each time the first summoned **Tamoto** attacks.

**Tamoto** can be pushed around, and moved by certain abilities, but are not Geo constructs and can not be destroyed.

After unlocking her 2nd or 4th Constellations, Chiori will now also be able to summon **Kinu** constructs - these act identically to **Tamoto** dolls but do higher damage. They can not be moved, and will disappear after attacking once, or after being on the field for 3 seconds.

- For an example for the distance to **Tamoto** to spawn the second one you can refer to [this video](https://youtu.be/qE6qKzCKUqI) - while **Tamoto** does not appear to be pushed in co-op for other players viewing it, the second **Tamoto** is not spawned when Chiori herself runs to the construct in the first clip.

pages.name: Elemental Burst Mechanics
pages.desc: Chiori's Elemental Burst is a simple and elegant attack, doing significant Geo DMG in a large AoE around her - this attack also does a large amount of damage to any Geo shields and constructs!

pages.name: Constellations
pages.desc:
While Chiori is already a strong character at C0, her Constellations are all quite useful if further investment into her is desired.
- **C1** - A very nice Quality of Life Constellation allowing Chiori to get full benefits of her Talents as long as there is another Geo character in the party removing the need for a construct. This notably increases her synergy with characters such as Navia and Noelle!
- **C2** - Chiori will now summon **Kinu** constructs after using her Elemental Burst, these constructs will spawn next to Chiori every 3 seconds, and a total of 3 will be summoned each use. This Constellation provides a very significant damage boost, but makes building Energy Recharge more appreciated on her as well.
- **C3** - Offers a significant damage increase, as the majority of her damage is from her Elemental Skill, this also increases the damage of the **Kinu** constructs.
- **C4** - Provides up to 3 more **Kinu** dolls when character Normal, Charged or Plunging attacks hit enemies after triggering either follow-effect of her Elemental Skills, provides the same overall damage as her 2nd Constellation.
- **C5** - Increased Elemental Burst levels increase her burst potential, but this Constellation is relatively minor otherwise.
- **C6** - Makes Chiori a very effective on-field damage dealer, both reducing the cooldown of her Elemental Skill, allowing her to permanently benefit from the Geo infusion from **Tailoring** as well as increasing her Normal Attack damage by a large portion of her defense.
This bonus applies to all her Normal Attack damage, regardless of infusion, but does not apply to her Charged Attack or Plunging Attack damage.

pages.name: Artifacts
pages.desc:
- 4pc **Golden Troupe** - This set maximizes her Elemental Skill damage, which is her primary source of damage.
- 4pc **Husk of Opulent Dreams** - While offering less Elemental Skill damage than Golden Troupe, this set offers higher Elemental Burst damage and can be kept up while on-field, synergizing well with her 6th Constellation.

2 piece combination mixes of **Golden Troupe**/**Husk of Opulent Dreams**/**Archaic Petra** and potentially 18% ATK sets can be utilized as well if lacking 4pc sets of **Golden Troupe** or **Husk of Opulent Dreams**.

For Artifact mainstats, Chiori prefers using a DEF% Sands, Geo % or DEF% Goblet and a Crit Rate/Crit Damage Circlet, primarily looking for Crit Rate, Crit Damage, DEF% and potentially Energy Recharge % substats.

pages.name: Weapons
pages.desc:
These weapons are typically the most recommended to use
- **Uraku Misugiri** - Chiori's signature weapon, and best in slot option, providing everything she wants from Crit DMG to Defense.
- **Primordial Jade Cutter** - Provides a very large amount of Crit Rate, and a decent amount of ATK, making it generally Chiori's second best option.
- **Harbinger of Dawn** - Extremely easy to obtain and performs better than most premium options when the passive is active, as Chiori does not primarily scale on attack.
- **Wolf-Fang** - at Refinement level 5, **Wolf-Fang** can perform similarly to **Primordial Jade Cutter**.

If none of the above options are possessed these options below can be considered as well:
- **Light of Foliar Incision** - A strong option off its base stats alone, providing a large amount of Crit Damage as well as a small amount of Crit Rate.
- **Mistsplitter Reforged** - It can be hard for Chiori to keep more than 1 stack of its passive, though if more can be obtained its performance increases. The high base ATK also makes this option stronger when Chiori receives ATK% buffs.
- **Haran Geppaku Futsu** - A good stat stick, providing good base stats and a good elemental damage bonus, the normal attack bonus can even be taken advantage of if Chiori is used on-field!
- **Cinnabar Spindle** - Defense substat is appreciated, however, it may be hard for Chiori to fully benefit from the Spotless Heart passive when she has 2 **Tamoto** active, as the gap between their attacks are less than the cooldown of this passive.

If Energy Recharge% is desired to use her Elemental Burst more often, these weapons can also be considered:
- **Festering Desire** - An old event weapon, providing a nice buff to her Elemental Skill damage and Crit Rate.
- **Fleuve Cendre Ferryman** - Free weapon from fishing, provides some Crit Rate for her Elemental Skill.

pages.name: Exploration Utility
pages.desc:
Chiori brings an exceptional amount of utility to any exploration team, having excellent synergies with many other characters who are useful to have while exploring.

First and foremost, she has an excellent exploration passive, granting the **Swift Stride** effect to the party, increasing their Movement SPD by 10%, when anyone in the party is equipping a Wind Glider that is not **Wings of First Flight**,  being the first ability of this kind that is effectively permanent!
* Note that this bonus does not work in content such as the Spiral Abyss.

Her Elemental Skill is extremely versatile, being able to cross large distances both vertical and horizontal, boasting the highest vertical reach of any ability in the game - beating even Venti's wind current! - as well as significant horizontal range, slightly beating out similar abilities like Alhaitham and Keqing.
* Her ability to swap to a different character in mid-air is also quite helpful when paired with characters who can use abilities while airborne like Xiao and Kazuha, allowing Chiori to adapt her abilities to help you during any difficult stretch of exploration!

A demonstration of her abilities can be seen [here](https://youtu.be/PLIWWiS9-XM)

pages.name: Materials
pages.desc:
Chiori's required boss material is **Artificed Spare Clockwork Component — Coppelia** which are obtained by defeating **Coppelia** in the **"Icewind Suite"** challenge in Fontaine.

As Chiori is a Geo character, she requires **Prithiva Topaz** gems to be ascended.

[**Dendrobium**](https://hutaobot.moe/guides/local-specialties-inazuma/dendrobium-route) are the local **Inazuma** specialty required to ascend her.

The common enemy drop she requires is from **Specters**, which can primarily be found in **[Inazuma](https://hutaobot.moe/guides/common-enemies/specter-route-inazuma) and [Enkanomiya](https://hutaobot.moe/guides/common-enemies/specter-route-enkanomiya)**.

Chiori's requires Talent books of **Light** which can be obtained from the **Inazuma** Talent Book domain on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays.

For leveling up her Talents past level 6, Chiori requires the Weekly Boss material; **Lightless Silk String** which can be obtained from the **Shadow of Another World** Trounce domain which is unlocked after completing **Chapter IV: Act V - Masquerade of the Guilty** Archon quest.

pages.name: Team Setups
pages.desc:
Chiori is very flexible in the teams she can be run in, though requiring another Geo character with a construct can appear limiting at first, she still performs excellently in teams without one even at C0, and with her 1st Constellation she can reach her full potential in teams with just another Geo character - like for an example in Navia teams!
Below are some example teams, but there are plenty of options that can be substituted in each of the teams, as her teams are very flexible.
* Particularly Zhongli paired with Chiori forms an extremely solid team core, being able to slot in almost any two other characters and yielding excellent results!

pages.name: Training Guide
pages.desc:
The Training Guide is a new feature you can access through the Paimon menu to bring up a menu which will show you the Adventure Power of the current characters in your party!

Clicking the **More Characters** button or the **Enhance** button on the displayed characters will bring you to a menu showing all your characters as well as bringing up the **Possible Improvements** tabs.

pages.name: Character Levels
pages.desc:
The Character Level tab is the first tab of possible improvements - this tab will list the sources of all the materials you are missing to ascend a character, allowing you to quickly get an overview of what materials you still need to gather.

Click the location icons to view where on the map these items can be found as well!

pages.name: Weapons
pages.desc: The Weapons tab will show whether or not you can Ascend and level up that character's current weapon, as well as show 3 commonly used Weapons on the chosen character by other Travelers!

pages.name: Artifacts
pages.desc:
The Artifacts tab will recommend you 3 artifact loadouts that are commonly used by other Travelers, as well as displaying if there is a recommended Artifact configuration it can equip using Quick Configurations.

Clicking the arrows next to the recommended artifact sets will navigate you to the domains that drop these artifacts.

pages.name: Character Talents
pages.desc: The Character Talents tab shows what Talents can still be upgraded, as well as displaying the sources of materials you may be missing - Clicking the location icons will show where these materials can be obtained. This feature also displays both the days Talent books can be obtained as well as showing the priority other Travelers raised the chosen character's Talents.

pages.name: Closing thoughts
pages.desc: The Training Guide feature is a useful feature for any Traveler who may be wondering how to further enhance their characters by providing advice from other recently active Travelers - it should be noted that there are always alternate ways to improve your characters based on the teams a Traveler may desire to use and there is not always one best way to build your characters for all situations!

pages.name: Arlecchino Quick Overview
pages.desc:
Arlecchino, the Fourth of the Fatui Harbingers, known as “the Knave”. Arlecchino runs the House of the Hearth, being known as “Father” to her “children”, which includes characters like Lyney, Lynette and Freminet as well as certain NPCs you will meet when exploring the world such as Lyudochka!

Arlecchino is a 5 star Pyro Polearm character, and introduces a new way of utilizing the Bond of Life mechanic introduced in Fontaine, using it as a resource to enhance her attacks!

You can use code **[RERBJ93N741C](https://genshin.hoyoverse.com/en/gift?code=RERBJ93N741C)** for some ingame rewards!

pages.name: Talent Mechanics
pages.desc:
Uniquely, Arlecchino can not be healed by sources other than her Elemental Burst during combat, but in trade she gains a permanent 40% Pyro Damage bonus during combat.

This part of her kit ensures that she will not lose damage by having her Bond of Life cleared by ally healing, as any healing would normally reduce Bond of Life. Though it also means care must be taken to manage her HP to fully take advantage of her abilities.

In addition Arlecchino will also gain 1% Resistance to all damage per 100 attack she has over 1000, capping out at 20% at 3000 attack. This is a dynamic increase, meaning attack buffs like Bennett can help reach this threshold. While this bonus helps Arlecchino’s survivability it is not sufficient to allow you to ignore enemy attacks - so care should be taken to not take too many hits.

pages.name: Normal Attack Mechanics
pages.desc:
The primary source of Arlecchino’s damage, after obtaining Bond of Life from absorbing **Blood-Debt Directives** and **Dues** applied from her Elemental Skill. When Arlecchino’s current Bond of Life amount is equal to or greater than 30% of her Maximum HP she will enter the **Masque of the Red Death** state, which enhances all her Normal, Charged and Plunging Attacks to do Pyro damage. **Masque of the Red Death** also causes her Normal Attacks only to deal bonus damage based on her current Bond of Life amount, then reducing it by 7.5%. When Bond of Life is consumed by her Normal Attacks in this state hitting enemies, they will also reduce her Elemental Skill’s cooldown by 0.8 seconds.

Her Charged Attack is her primary way to absorb **Blood-Debt Directives** and **Dues** to grant herself Bond of Life. It is usually only used for this purpose, as it does not gain increased damage from **Masque of the Red Death**.

pages.name: Elemental Skill Mechanics
pages.desc:
A frontward facing AoE doing Pyro Damage to all enemies hit and applying a **Blood-Debt Directive** to them.

**Blood-Debt Directives** periodically do Pyro damage to the targets they are applied to, and will grant Arlecchino a Bond of Life worth 65% of her max HP when absorbed by her Charged Attack or Elemental Burst. **Blood-Debt Directives** will also be enhanced to **Blood-Debt Dues** which are identical to **Directives**, except will grant Arlecchino a Bond of Life worth 130% of her max HP instead.

If an enemy with a **Blood-Debt Directive** or **Due** dies, Arlecchino will also be granted a Bond of Life worth 130% of her max HP.

While the maximum amount of Bond of Life that can be obtained per use of All Is Ash is 145%, Arlecchino is able to obtain a 200% Bond of Life when absorbing further **Directive/Dues** if using her Elemental Skill again and absorbing further ones when she already possesses at least 55% Bond of Life.

pages.name: Elemental Burst Mechanics
pages.desc:
Arlecchino’s Elemental Burst is a large frontal AoE nuke that first absorbs all nearby **Blood-Debt Directives and Dues**, then heals herself and resets her Elemental Skill's cooldown.

This is Arlecchino’s only way to heal herself in combat, so it is usually recommended to only Burst when healing is required unless sufficient Energy Recharge is built to use it every rotation.

As it heals for 150% of her current Bond of Life + 150% of her Attack, the healing Arlecchino receives will be equal to 50% of her Bond of Life + 150% of her attack. This is because 100% of the Bond healing is consumed to clear her remaining Bond of Life.

An example would be 50% HP Bond of Life (15000 HP, 7500 Bond value) and 2000 attack, this will cause Arlecchino to heal for a total amount of `7500*50%+2000*150%=6750` health.

pages.name: Constellations
pages.desc:
- **C1** - Primarily good for the increased damage it grants her Normal Attacks, being a 20%+ increase to her Normal Attack damage. The interruption resistance can be helpful when playing her without a shield, but does not alleviate her fragility.
- **C2** - Removes the need to wait for setup, as **Blood-Debt Directives** will be **Due** when applied. Increases Arlecchino’s frontload potential by granting her an AoE nuke when she absorbs these **Dues**,  and further increases all her damage resistance by another 20% when this is triggered.
- **C3** - As Arlecchino’s primary damage comes from her Normal Attacks, this Constellation offers a significant damage increase.
- **C4** - Makes it easier to use Arlecchino’s Elemental Burst every rotation, the Cooldown Reduction is not particularly impactful however.
- **C5** - Elemental Burst levels only increase the damage it does, not very significant overall, but works well with her final Constellation.
- **C6** - Increases Arlecchino’s Elemental Burst damage by a massive amount based on her current amount of Bond of Life, making it worth using purely for damage.
- Note that as this is scaling based on her current Bond of Life care should be taken not to use it at the end of a rotation when her Bond of Life has been depleted, instead it can often be ideal to use it immediately after her Elemental Skill to absorb the newly applied **Dues** which also resets her Elemental Skill to allow her to use it again if anything is still alive.
Also grants a significant CRIT Rate and CRIT Damage increase after using her Elemental Skill. Overall an extremely potent buff, befitting of a capstone Constellation.

pages.name: Artifacts
pages.desc:
- 4-Piece **Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy** - Arlecchino’s best artifact option, she is easily able to keep the passive maximized by playing normally.
- 4-Piece **Gladiator’s Finale** - Arlecchino’s second best option, noticeably increasing the damage of her Normal Attacks. Also passively farmable from Weekly/World bosses.

- 4-Piece **Crimson Witch of Flames**/**Gilded Dreams** are alternatives that can be used, primarily for Vaporize teams.

- 2-Piece combination mixes of **Crimson Witch of Flames** and **18% ATK** sets can be utilized while farming for 4-Piece sets.

For Artifact mainstats, Arlecchino prefers using a ATK% Sands (or Elemental Mastery if running Vaporize), Pyro % Goblet and a Crit Rate/Crit Damage Circlet, primarily looking for Crit Rate, Crit Damage, ATK% substats and potentially Elemental Mastery if using Arlecchino in a Vaporize team.

pages.name: Weapons
pages.desc:
Recommended weapons for Arlecchino

- **Crimson Moon’s Semblance** - Arlecchino’s signature and best weapon. Tailor-made for her, granting her both additional Bond of Life as well as a nice damage bonus that is always active while Arlecchino is in the "Masque of the Red Death" state. As a bonus it also looks very fashionable on her, transforming into a Scythe when used!
- **Primordial Jade Winged-Spear** - Arlecchino’s second best option, providing a strong passive that she can easily stack and great base stats.
- **Staff of the Scarlet Sands** - A competitive option, especially when run in Vaporize teams.


- **Staff of Homa** - Strong option, even when above 50% HP.
- **Deathmatch** - Good generic option from the Battle Pass.
- **Ballad of the Fjords** - Can be stronger than Deathmatch in Vaporize teams.

- **White Tassel** -  Arlecchino’s best free option, it can be randomly obtained from any chests of Exquisite quality or higher in Liyue (including Chasm/Chenyu Vale).

pages.name: Exploration Utility
pages.desc:
Possessing a unique travel ability, Arlecchino does bring a flexible exploration ability to the table. Her quick-travel when holding down the Charged Attack button can be used to both quickly cross between groups of enemies, as well as travel over smaller bodies of water!

A demonstration of the travel distance can be seen [here](https://youtu.be/vfWs3j-S5co).

Her Charged Attack can also be chained over bodies of water without entering her unique travel ability - it will even travel a similar distance! However, this is rarely practical as you can easily fall into the water, but it looks quite fancy when performed!

A demonstration can be seen [here](https://youtu.be/gRkS6ayk4c4).

As her Bond of Life does not fall off based on a duration she can also act as an excellent overworld DPS, not being tied to any particular damage windows or ramp up if you end battles with Bond of Life still on Arlecchino.

pages.name: Materials
pages.desc:
Arlecchino’s boss material needed is **Fragment of a Golden Melody** obtained from the [**Statue of Marble and Brass**](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Legastus_Golem_Location_093fce6f.png) Boss challenge in Petrichor.

As Arlecchino is a Pyro character, she requires **Agnidus Agate** gems to be ascended.

[**Rainbow Roses**](https://hutaobot.moe/guides/local-specialties-fontaine/rainbow-rose-route) are the **Fontaine** local specialty required to ascend her.

The common enemy drop she requires is **Fatui Insignias**, which can primarily be found by defeating [**Fatui Skirmishers**](https://hutaobot.moe/guides/common-enemies/fatui-skirmisher-route).

Arlecchino requires Talent books of **Order** which can be obtained from the **Fontaine** Talent Book domain on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays.

For leveling up her Talents past level 6, Arlecchino requires the Weekly Boss material; **Fading Candle** which can be obtained from the **Scattered Ruins** Trounce domain which is unlocked after completing the **Ignis Purgatorius Chapter: Act I - When the Hearth-Flame Goes Out** Story quest.

You can use code **[RERBJ93N741C](https://genshin.hoyoverse.com/en/gift?code=RERBJ93N741C)** for some ingame rewards!

pages.name: Teammates
pages.desc:
Here is a list of a few characters that can synergize well with Arlecchino, but it is by no means an exhaustive list!

__**Anemo:**__
- **Kazuha** - Provides decent grouping and an excellent Pyro DMG buff when he swirls Pyro.
- **Sucrose** - Works great in Vaporize teams, able to both provide EM buffs alongside an ATK buff when holding Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers.
- **Lynette** - Can provide a small ATK buff as well as provide a taunt to draw attacks away from Arlecchino.

__**Cryo:**__
- **Diona** - Can provide a shield as well as solid Elemental Mastery buff with her 6th Constellation unlocked.
- **Layla** - Provides a strong shield and solid off-field Cryo application, can hold Tenacity of the Millelith artifacts to increase Arlecchino attack as well as shield strength.

__**Electro:**__
- **Fischl** - An excellent option in any team that triggers Electro reactions, providing good off-field Electro application and damage.
- **Beidou** - Provides interruption resistance and damage reduction through her Elemental Burst as well as good multi-target damage.

__**Geo:**__
- **Zhongli** - The premier shielding option, with a long lasting and durable shield.
- **Albedo/Chiori** - Great pairings with Zhongli; providing Geo resonance and significant off-field damage.
- **Yun Jin** - Provides strong Normal Attack buffs appreciated by Arlecchino.

__**Hydro:**__
- **Xingqiu** - Provides both sufficient Hydro application as well as damage and interruption resistance.
- **Yelan** - Provides a strong ramping damage buff as well as good Hydro application

__**Pyro:**__
- **Bennett** - While unable to heal Arlecchino, his significant attack buff from his Elemental Burst.
- **Chevreuse** - Provides powerful buffs that are not tied to a fixed location, limits team options to just Pyro and Electro teammates but can often be worth it.
- **Thoma/Yanfei** (C4+) - Can provide a shield while using Chevreuse, Yanfei can also hold Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers for even further buffs.

pages.name: Example Teams
pages.desc:
Below are some example teams Arlecchino can be run in, they can usually be divided into three main archetypes:
- **Vaporize (Melt)**: Teams where Arlecchino takes advantage of amplifying reactions, utilizing characters with good Hydro applications like Xingqiu to enhance her damage. Elemental Mastery can be a good stat to build in these teams.
- **"Mono" Pyro**: Often more brute force teams, run with either Anemo units for Viridescent Venerer Pyro Resistance reduction or Geo for comfort.
- **Chevreuse/Overload**: Takes advantage of Chevreuse's significant buffs in teams of only Pyro and Electro characters. Knockback from Overloaded is not as significant for Arlecchino thanks to the reach of her attacks.

It must be noted that in any team run without a shielder, care must be taken to dodge dangerous enemy attacks, and avoiding chip damage is ideal. This is because Arlecchino is unable to receive healing from other characters making mistakes during gameplay significantly more punishing.

There are many more teams than just the ones shown here, and experimenting with what works well for you is recommended!

pages.name: Canticles of Harmony Overview
pages.desc:
Taking a journey through the area once known as **Remuria**, the **Canticles of Harmony** questline is the primary questline for the **Nostoi** and the **Sea of Bygone Eras** regions of **Fontaine**.

**Remuria** was once a kingdom located in what is modern day **Fontaine**, founded by **Remus Sebastos**. In this questline you will journey with **Osse**, a talking... cat?, and travel through the ruins of **Remuria** to investigate the mystery of people falling into a dream-like state in **Petrichor**.

This questline is required to unlock the  **Faded Castle** underground area at **Petrichor** and the **Sea of Bygone Eras** map.

You can use code **[RERBJ93N741C](https://genshin.hoyoverse.com/en/gift?code=RERBJ93N741C)** for some ingame rewards!

pages.name: Prerequisites and where to start
pages.desc:
To start the questline, approach the NPC with a **!** above them near the Statue of the Seven in **Petrichor**.

- It is recommended to have completed the **Archon Quest Prologue: Act III "Song of the Dragon and Freedom"** to automatically unlock the waypoint at **Petrichor**.

pages.name: Exploring Petrichor
pages.desc:
1 - After triggering the first cutscene, head into **Petrichor** and approach the NPC shown as **???** in the town square.

2 - Then follow the quest navigation to the seal into the **Faded Castle**. Defeat the Praetorian Golem that is guarding the Score and pick it up from the Pedestal to unlock the seal, then enter the **Faded Castle**.

pages.name: The Faded Castle
pages.desc:
Upon entering the **Faded Castle** keep progressing deeper into the ruins following the quest navigation.
- Once you reach the first intersection (Marked **1**) you will obtain the **Ancient Autoharmonic Music Box** as well as obtain score number 1: **Locus Amoenus**.
- You can access the **Legatus Golem** world boss after this step! Take the stairs down and to the south at the intersection instead to reach it as seen [here](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/Legastus_Golem_Location_093fce6f.png).

Follow Osse into the room marked **2** and solve the puzzle
- Hold the Music/Symphony button down to move the markers on each device, move the markers so they light up the same symbol as on the wall behind each device to solve.

Head to the stage marked **3**, insert the **Blank Score** and defeat the enemies to activate the portal, then enter the **Sea of Bygone Eras**.

pages.name: Initium Iani and Scylla
pages.desc:
After entering the **Sea of Bygone Eras** the first half of the map will be lit up after taking the water current and approaching **Scylla**.

Now, the aim is to free **Scylla**. To do this, follow the 3 links that form the prison to a puzzle each to solve them. After solving each puzzle **hold down** the **Music/Symphony** button near the red spire that connects the seal to release the seal.
* 1 - Enter the cave at **1** and talk to the **Praetorian Golems** nearby and start negotiating with them. The correct answers to avoid fighting them are: **The Sebastos does not permit the harm of innocent people.**, **Yet you are not receiving the melody.** and **Phobos's silence signifies rejection.**
* 2 - Defeat the **Praetorian Golems** inside the cave.
* 3 - [Solve the puzzle](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/CoH_Music_puzzle_168cc170.png) by pausing the **Washer Octopi** by **tapping** the **Music/Symphony** button near them so they activate all the **Resonant Anemones**.

If you pause a **Washer Octopus** at an incorrect spot, you can make it start moving again by **holding** the **Music/Symphony** button near it.

pages.name: Approaching the Domus Aurea
pages.desc:
After freeing **Scylla** you must break the seal to the second half of the **Sea of Bygone Eras**. This is done by hitting the button prompt on screen within the countdown when it appears.

If a prompt is missed, you will be taken back to the start of the current. The challenge can easily be restarted by just talking to **Scylla** again though!
* Completing this challenge will light up the rest of the **Sea of Bygone Eras** map.

pages.name: Scylla Taxi Service
pages.desc:
After freeing **Scylla** you can fast travel to him when you are nearby, pressing the interaction button that appears to quickly rush to him. After doing so you can **Summon the current...** to launch yourself in a direction of your choice.
* At intervals an arrow button will appear on screen. Hit the prompt before it expires if you wish to travel further.
* **Scylla**'s location on the map will also be indicated by a Whale icon!

This mechanic can be used to quickly navigate between areas during this next part of the quest!

Doing this for the first time also yields the achievement **Vishap Corps Scylla**!

pages.name: Domus Aurea and the Aqueducts
pages.desc:
Follow the quest marker and enter the **Domus Aurea** after entering you will be challenged by a few praetorian golems, there is no need to defeat them, as surviving for a little while will see the next cutscene begin.

After you progress the quest to rebuild the **Golden Aqueducts** you will receive 2 additional quests in your quest log:
* **Golden Aqueduct Reconstruction: Part I** and **Golden Aqueduct Reconstruction: Part II**
* You can navigate these quests to see where you need to go to restore them. **Scylla** will be located near them so you can use him to quickly travel to them.

To repair each aqueduct you must move the flying birds (the ones you must move are marked in the image below) by **touching** them until they go to their marked spots on the mural.
* During **Part II** the flying anemo slimes must be popped to free one of the trapped birds, and the **Pink Hat Jellyfish** in the area can be used to reach the two suspended birds!

In addition you also need to align the projectors so their perspective has the horn overlapping the horn on the mural!

pages.name: Releasing the Ichor into the Aqueducts
pages.desc:
After following the Bird Phantasms and repairing the Aqueducts, head back to the **Domus Aurea** and activate the Wheel device to release the Ichor.

This will start another sequence where you must hit the button prompts when they appear on screen.

Enter the **Domus Aurea** again at the end and prepare to face **Boethius**.
* Note that Co-Op mode will be disabled after this step, so make sure you are prepared!

pages.name: Confronting Boethius
pages.desc:
**Boethius** takes the form of a **Legatus Golem** during battle, and is a relatively straightforward fight.
* During the first phase, **Boethius** will be shielded and take significantly reduced damage. This shield can quickly be depleted using **Blunt** attacks like **Claymores**, **Plunging Attacks** and certain **Geo** attacks. In addition reactions like **Overloaded** can do significant damage to his shield too!
* Breaking the **resonators** that spawn will also further deplete the shield.

Don't forget that you can use food buffs if you're struggling with the fight!

pages.name: Requiem
pages.desc:
At the end of it all is the **Requiem**, this is the final sequence, where a timed button prompt must be hit within the displayed window on screen.
* Missing a prompt will cause a section to replay, but it will not restart the entire **Requiem**.

After completing the **Requiem** you will receive the 6th score for the **Ancient Autoharmonic Music Box**, known as "**Lacrimosa**".
* The other 4 scores can be found by exploring these two new regions! (Or if you just want the locations you can see this image [here!](https://static.hutaobot.moe/images/CoH_Autoharmonic_music_box_store_e813dd2f.png))

pages.name: Imaginarium Theater Overview
pages.desc:
The **Imaginarium Theater** is a new permanent end-game mode added to Genshin Impact in version 4.7. It is a rotating game mode, with seasons lasting for 1 month each.

The primary gameplay mechanic of this mode is a limit on what characters can be brought during each season, being restricted to specific elements and some special guests each rotation. This means the **Imaginarium Theater** is suited for any player with a diverse cast of characters to challenge!

The **Imaginarium Theater** also introduces a variety of stage effects and random boons that can be obtained during combat, making every run different and allowing players to experience team combinations they may not otherwise use!

To access the Imaginarium Theater, players must reach **Adventure Rank** 35 then complete the World Quest: "**Unbegun, Unending Story**".

pages.name: Seasons
pages.desc:
The seasons in the **Imaginarium Theater** change the **Opening Cast**, **special guests**, as well as the Elemental requirements for **Eligible members** to participate.
* **Special Guests** are a set of characters picked for each season that do not need to match the Elemental requirements.
* Members of the **Opening Cast** during each season will also gain a 20% increase to their **HP**, **ATK** and **DEF** when used, even outside the **Imaginarium Theater**!

The **Imaginarium Theater** updates at the start of each month, replacing the Spiral Abyss reset that would have occurred at that time. This means every two weeks will alternate between updating the **Imaginarium Theater** and the  **Spiral Abyss**, with the **Imaginarium Theater** updating at the start, and the **Spiral Abyss** in the middle of each month.

The Season Rules - what characters are in the **Opening Cast** and what Elements are available to use - can be viewed by clicking the info prompt at the main menu screen for the **Imaginarium Theater**
* **Special Guests** can be viewed when selecting characters to add to the **Alternate Cast**.

pages.name: Challenging the Imaginarium Theater
pages.desc:
After unlocking the **Imaginarium Theater**, it can be challenged inside the **Knights of Favonius Library** in Mondstadt. **Interact with the Book** on the long table, and select **Performance Prep** to begin a Performance.

There are 3 difficulties that can be selected, which influence the length of the Performance, as well as the level of the enemies you will encounter during the challenge.
* If you do not possess a sufficient amount of **eligible characters** for the respective difficulty (requirements listed below), you will be unable to select that difficulty.

**Easy Mode**
* A total of 3 Battle Events must be completed to finish a Performance.
* In addition to the Opening Cast, **4 eligible characters** must be selected to participate in the Performance for a total of 10 participants, and participants must be at least **Level 60**.


**Normal Mode**
* A total of 6 Battle Events must be completed to finish a Performance.
* In addition to the Opening Cast, **8 eligible characters** must be selected to participate in the Performance for a total of 14 participants, and participants must be at least **Level 60**.


**Hard Mode**
* A total of 8 Battle Events must be completed to finish a Performance.
* In addition to the Opening Cast, **12 eligible characters** must be selected to participate in the Performance for a total of 18 participants, and participants must be at least **Level 70**.


**Eligible characters** are character matching the current season's elemental types, as well as the **special guests** for the current season.

pages.name: Principal and Alternate Cast (Characters)
pages.desc:
After selecting a difficulty, it is time to choose the characters who will participate in the Performance.

When challenging the** Imaginarium Theater**, the initial **Principal Cast** will consist of the **Opening Cast** of that season, which will let you pick between trial versions of these characters as well as your own, but each character can only be selected once.

The **Principal Cast** refers to the characters that can currently be selected when preparing for a battle.

The **Alternate Cast** is the set of characters that can be randomly added to the **Principal Cast** during a Performance, when starting a Performance, a number of **eligible characters** must be selected, with the number being based on the difficulty chosen.

Members of the **Alternate Cast** can join the **Principal Cast** in two main ways:
* Completing Battle Events.
* Selecting Companion Events.

**Supporting Cast:**
