The Supporting Cast feature allows players to add 1 character from a friend to their **Alternate Cast** during character selection. However, a person can only have 15 friends borrow a character from them each season - so make sure to lock in your preferred support for the season as soon as possible!
* The same Supporting character will be selected during the current Season when starting a new Performance unless replaced, allowing you to keep using them without expending additional support usages.


**Setting your own Supporting Cast:**
During each season, you can set up to 7 characters into your **Supporting Cast** that your friends can view and borrow, excluding any characters in the **Opening Cast**.
* Note that while you can set any character to your **Supporting Cast**,  your friends are not able to see or use characters that do not match the current season's elements or special guest list.

pages.name: Performing a Performance
pages.desc:
After selecting all characters in the **Principal** and **Alternate Casts** to join the Performance, you will progress to the challenge stage, where you will be able to pick between various Event Cards.

There are 4 main types of Event Cards that can appear:
* Battles
* Companions
* Wondrous Boons
* Mystery Caches

You can view all available cards before deciding which one to select, and a limited number of rerolls are granted each Performance that you can use by clicking the **Refresh Events** button in the bottom-right corner to change out the current selection of events with a new batch.
* If you select a non-Battle Event, it will reroll all non-Battle Events as well, which can save you rerolls for difficult stages!

To progress to the next act of a performance, a **Battle:** event must be chosen.
* If all enemy lineups seem difficult to handle, **refreshing** events will refresh non-**Climactic Showdown** enemies!

pages.name: Battle Events
pages.desc:
Battle Events, are how to progress to the next Acts in a performance. They are also the primary source for **Fantasia Flowers** that can be spent on activating other Event Cards during card selection.


There are 3 primary divisions of Battle Events:

**Normal**
Standard combat challenges, comprising of **Normal** and **Defense Sequences**.
* **Normal** Battle events are completed by defeating all enemies (or in some cases, a certain number of enemies within a time limit).
* **Defense Sequence** challenges are completed by preventing the Leyline Monolith from being destroyed within the time limit.


**Elite**
Comprises of **Elite Assault** and **High-Pressure Defense** challenges, these challenges have chance to randomly appear whenever a Normal Combat Event can occur, and give greater rewards in trade for their higher difficulty.
* **Elite Assault** have identical requirements to **Normal** events.
* **High-Pressure Defense** challenges have identical requirements to **Defense Sequence** events.


**Climactic Showdown**
The Boss battles encountered during a Performance, **Climactic Showdowns** are encountered during **Act 3, 6** and **8** of a Performance and serve as the milestones for a performance.
* They are completed by defeating the boss(es) that appear in that stage.


**Performance Goals**
Every Battle Event will also have a set of **Performance Goals** that grant bonus rewards if completed.
* **Bonus Challenges** award additional Fantasia Flowers if completed, and can include defeating enemies in a certain way, triggering certain reactions and other similar requirements.
* **Star Challenges** grant a star that can be seen on your profile if completed.
Performance goals are **not** required to obtain stage rewards.


**Stage Effects**
Certain stages can have various effects that take place during the battle, these are generally effects that can negatively impact the player. They can be viewed by checking the **Stage Effects** tab.

pages.name: Vigor
pages.desc:
All characters start out with 2 Vigor after being added to the Principal Cast, and lose 1 Vigor after participating in a **Combat Event**.


Once a character's Vigor hits 0, they will be removed from the Principal Cast and can no longer be used.


How much Vigor a character currently has is indicated by the number of bright ⚡ symbols  on their character icon and can be viewed before entering a Combat Event as well as in the **Performance Details** tab.


Keep an eye out on how much Vigor and how many characters you have available, as you need at least 4 characters with at least 1 Vigor to be able to take part of a Combat Event! Invite additional characters when needed to smoothly complete a Performance.

pages.name: Wondrous Boons and Mystery Caches
pages.desc:
**Wondrous Boons**
By spending 60 Fantasia Flowers you can select Wondrous Boons that grant in-combat buffs that can enhance your battle experience in various ways.
* By default, when selecting Mysterious Boons you will be able to pick between 3 random buffs.
* Many of these buffs will synergize with specific elements or reactions of the eligible elements of the current season. Paying attention to what characters you have brought as companions who are still available is essential to making the most out of these events!


When you receive External Audience Support from characters that were not selected to participate in the **Imaginarium Theater**, the effects of some of these boons can be enhanced!


**Mystery Caches**
Mystery Caches provide various beneficial effects that are not directly combat related. These can range from increasing the number of event cards that appear, the number of options when selecting buffs, granting Fantasia Flowers, granting more reroll chances, restoring Vigor to characters and many more!
* By default, you will be able to pick between 2 random options when selecting a Mysterious Cache.
* Normal Mysterious Caches are free, but rarely you will see Mysterious Caches: Rare that cost 40 Fantasia Flowers.


Obtained **Wondrous Boons** and **Mystery Cache** effects can be viewed in the **Performance Details** tab.

pages.name: Companion Events
pages.desc:
Companion Events allow you to spend Fantasia Flowers to invite members of the **Alternate Cast** to join the **Principal Cast**.


There are three different types of Companion Events that can be encountered:
* **Companion: Random** - Choose 1 character from 2 random options.
* **Companion: Select** - Choose 1 character from 2 random options that share an element.
* **Companion: Invite** - Choose 1 character from 6 random options.


It is important to use Companion Events to make sure you have enough characters to complete a Performance!


External Audience Support can also randomly be triggered when selecting Companion Events, which can refund Fantasia Flowers.

pages.name: Rewinding a Performance
pages.desc:
After completing a **Climactic Showdown** Battle Event, the **Rewind** feature becomes available for use. The option to **Rewind** can be found in the **Performance Details** tab.


When rewinding a Performance, the progress for the current Performance will be reset to the state it was right after the last **Climactic Showdown** completed - this includes character status as well as any **Mysterious Boons** and **Wondrous Caches** obtained.
* Note that **Rewinding** will also reset any records from Challenges that are reset by the rewind.


**Rewind** can only be performed once every Performance, so make sure to use it wisely.
* If you are unable to progress a Performance with your current cast, rewinding and trying to obtain different Cast members and Boons can be a good option without having to restart the entire Performance.

pages.name: Tips & Tricks
pages.desc:
**General**
* It is recommended to spread your investment over multiple characters instead of focusing on only a few, as outside of the opening cast you can not guarantee that you will obtain them if only a few are invested into.
* **Defense Sequence** challenges only appear during **Act 4**, where all Battle events will be defense.
* **Bonus** and **Star** challenges are not mandatory, if their conditions are too difficult, they can be skipped.
* As the boss enemies can be viewed beforehand, saving characters that match well into them can help progress the most difficult Acts.
* Save enough **Fantasia Flowers** to ensure you have sufficient characters to complete stages, but there is no need to hoard them, and spending some on **Wondrous Boons** and **Mysterious Caches** can be highly beneficial!
* Regular **Mysterious Caches** are free, and it never hurts to pick them up.


**Team building**
*  Teams with 1-2 damage dealers and 2-3 supports are often smoother to play than teams with too many damage dealers.
* Pay attention to the enemy lineup and listed Advantages for a stage and bring characters who meet their conditions when possible!
* It can often be beneficial to bring more supports than damage dealers in your Alternate Cast to fill out team slots.
* It is not required to always use the best characters you have available, and using a decent team and saving stronger characters can be beneficial.
* Taking Advantage of any **Wondrous Boons** obtained can make this easier.

pages.name: Rewards
pages.desc:
As a monthly rotating gamemode, the **Imaginarium Theater** comes with its own set of recurring rewards known as **Performance Tour Rewards** which refresh at the start of every season. These rewards include Primogems, Mora, Character Talent level up materials as well as Artifact Experience.


A total of 620 Primogems can be obtained each season if all 8 Acts are completed.
* If only **Easy Mode** is completed, a total of 220 Primogems can be obtained as only **3 Acts** can be done during each challenge.
* If **Normal Mode** is the highest difficulty completed, a total of 440 Primogems can be obtained, as **Normal Mode** ends after **Act 6**.


Combined with the increase of the Primogem rewards in the **Spiral Abyss** to 800 from 600, this means players can now obtain a total of 1420 Primogems from these rotating gamemodes a month, which is a 220 increase over the 1200 previously!


In addition to these rewards, certain cosmetic rewards can also be obtained which can add a unique flair to certain characters! Currently these rewards include **Thespian Tricks** and **Envisaged Echoes**.

pages.name: Thespian Tricks
pages.desc:
**Thespian Tricks** are various poses that can be used during Photo Mode - You can unlock unique poses for various characters by talking to **Wolfy** and exchanging **Toy Medals** for them.


**Toy Medals** can be obtained from the **Performance Tour Rewards** after completing **Act 3, 6** and **8** during that season.


New **Thespian Tricks** will periodically be added to the **Imaginarium Theater** as new season begin.

pages.name: Envisaged Echoes
pages.desc:
Added in version 4.8, Envisaged Echoes are another cosmetic upgrade that is available for certain characters.
* As with **Thespian Tricks**, more Echoes will periodically be added.


To unlock an Echo, the eligible character must be **Level 90**, **Friendship Level 8+** and two **Keys of Echoes** must be spent to unlock that character's unique challenge.
* Completing the respective challenge will then unlock that character's unique Echo cosmetic. You can then equip it in their **Outfit** menu.
* Echoes can be previewed by clicking the Chest icon on each challenge icon.


**Keys of Echoes** can be obtained from completing **Act 6** of the **Imaginarium Theater** every season, meaning it takes 2 seasons to get enough keys to unlock one echo.
* You can only hold up to 4 Keys at any one time.

pages.name: Interacting with your Allies
pages.desc:
Added in version 4.8, Envisaged Echoes are another cosmetic upgrade that is available for certain characters.
* As with **Thespian Tricks**, more Echoes will periodically be added.

pages.name: Closing Thoughts
pages.desc:
In addition to the cosmetic rewards, you will also be able to talk the the characters you last used to complete an Act in the **Imaginarium Theater**.
* These lines are even voiced, adding a nice atmosphere to the challenge whenever you wish to take a break.

You will be able to find them relaxing around the theater itself, taking in the sights and exploring its amenities.
